intro: Euphorbion apium, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. It has a taproot system and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings. Euphorbion apium is known for its ability to tolerate various soil conditions and is relatively easy to propagate from seeds.
